definition: A white wine grape from Catalonia, Spain utilized in the production of Cava.
A prominent red wine grape found in Greece.
One of the most significant modern wine-producing regions in Asia, with rapidly growing vineyards and international recognition.
A traditional Mayan liqueur from Mexico’s Yucatán Peninsula made from fermented honey and anise; sweet, herbal, and floral.
A White wine grape from Cyprus. Xynisteri is the most planted white varietal on the island.
